page.title: 13RELIGION-ST GARMON'S WELL
page.content: St Garmon's well is to be found in a field belonging to Ty Coch farm.St Garmon when he came here in about 450 AD used water from the well to baptise infant children.Later the water was taken to the font in St Garmon's church.It is believed that St Garmon's planted a yew tree beside his well.One day some children were trying to catch a rabbit and the rabbit ran into the yew tree so the children set it on fire to try and smoke the rabbit out but unforunatly they didn't realise that was the yew tree that St Garmon's planted to make a prayer desk out of it.Today the well is neglected but still contains water.
